Stories of Impact

Family voices that shape how Iowa CYP shows up

Every camp recap, porch drop-off, and teen leadership story keeps us focused on what Guard-connected youth really need. Explore the moments below and pass them along to partners who want to understand the work.

  • Guard kids stay connected

    Adventure Kits keep conversations going during drill weekends and deployments.

  • Camp changes the tone

    Mentors, shared traditions, and leadership roles rebuild confidence fast.

  • Families find their circle

    Seasonal gatherings and Yellow Ribbon weekends offer instant understanding.

  • Teens lead the way

    State Teen Panel members bring new ideas and keep peers involved statewide.

Explore family snapshots Share your story

Family snapshots

Programs that keep momentum strong at home

These quick reads show how practical support—kits, camps, and community touchpoints—can shift the energy at home and keep Guard kids feeling steady.

Adventure Kits spark resilience at home

Families across Iowa use the quarterly Online Adventure Kits to keep conversations going during long trainings and deployments. Hands-on activities make it easier for kids to talk about feelings, try new skills, and feel connected to the Guard community.

“The support these kids receive is incredible--it reminds them they're not alone. Military life is tough, and we're grateful for CYP helping our children feel seen and supported through it all.” ARNG Parent

Programs featured: Online Adventure Kits

Summer Camp restores confidence

A parent told us camp 'brightened our daughter's smile again.' Between shared traditions, mentor support, and daily leadership challenges, campers leave knowing they are part of something bigger than themselves.

“The support these kids receive is incredible--it reminds them they're not alone. Military life is tough, and we're grateful for CYP helping our children feel seen and supported through it all.” ARNG Parent

Programs featured: Summer Camp, State Teen Panel

Community events keep families connected

Seasonal gatherings like the Fall Family Festival, Cookies with Santa, and regional MFEs bring Guard families together. Partners provide activities, meals, and welcoming spaces so every age group can celebrate alongside people who understand military life.

“The support these kids receive is incredible--it reminds them they're not alone. Military life is tough, and we're grateful for CYP helping our children feel seen and supported through it all.” ARNG Parent

Programs featured: Military Family Events, Yellow Ribbon

Guard family rhythm

Support that meets families in every phase

Deployments and trainings reshape home life more than once. Here’s what families notice as Iowa CYP weaves in encouragement, information, and community throughout the cycle.

1

When orders drop

Orientation nights, Yellow Ribbon workshops, and family readiness touchpoints help everyone map out the next few months together.

“The support these kids receive is incredible--it reminds them they're not alone. Military life is tough, and we're grateful for CYP helping our children feel seen and supported through it all.” ARNG Parent
2

During the long stretch

Online Adventure Kits, check-in calls, and teen panel meetups keep Guard kids practicing resilience in between texts and video chats with their service member.

“The support these kids receive is incredible--it reminds them they're not alone. Military life is tough, and we're grateful for CYP helping our children feel seen and supported through it all.” ARNG Parent
3

Coming back together

Camp reunions, resource referrals, and community celebrations make reintegration feel less overwhelming and remind families they’re not doing it alone.

“The support these kids receive is incredible--it reminds them they're not alone. Military life is tough, and we're grateful for CYP helping our children feel seen and supported through it all.” ARNG Parent

Community spotlight

News story: Community lifts families during deployment

Program Director Chris Cox sat down with local news to share how partners step in when Guard families face deployments. The feature highlights a free horse camp hosted by Jester Park Equestrian Center that gave military youth room to breathe, laugh, and stay connected while a parent was away.

  • Why it mattered: Volunteers, donors, and Jester Park covered every cost so Guard kids could simply show up.
  • What families said: Time with the horses eased anxiety and sparked conversations about deployment in a safe setting.
  • How to use it: Share this clip with civic groups and potential sponsors who want real examples of community impact.

Full interview: Chris Cox explains how community partners like Jester Park Equestrian Center rally around Guard families to keep kids grounded during deployment.

Parent perspective

Finding friendship after a cross-country move

When one Guard family relocated from Texas to Iowa, their daughter wondered who would understand what military life felt like. In this short clip, her mom shares how a familiar face from an Iowa CYP program turned into instant camaraderie—and how that connection steadied their whole household.

  • Shared experience: A fellow military youth spotted her at camp and reminded her she wasn’t starting over alone.
  • Ripple effect: Confidence followed her home, making the new duty station feel less overwhelming.
  • Takeaway: CYP friendships can outlast moves and mobilizations, giving kids anchors no matter the zip code.

Use this testimony when talking with school counselors, partner organizations, or potential sponsors who want to understand the on-the-ground impact of CYP relationships.

Mission in Motion

Show up for Guard-connected kids and caregivers with year-round experiences, practical resources, and caring adults so home life stays steady through every drill, mobilization, and return.

  • Partnership Cultivation: Grow local and statewide partners who help us stretch funding, add fresh experiences, and keep families covered.
  • Storytelling & Advocacy: Share real Guard family stories so decision-makers understand the wins, the gaps, and why support matters.
  • Data Collection & Outcome Reporting: Track participation and outcomes so we can show readiness, resilience, and retention gains.
  • Marketing & Visibility: Keep families and leaders in the loop with clear, consistent updates and event branding.

See the program in action

Share this overview with partners and community members to invite new champions into the work.

Fostering community, resilience, and positive development among Iowa's military-connected children and families.
